snippet: He helped install Augusto Pinochet as president in a 1973 coup and was implicated in the murder or disappearance of more than 75 Chileans.
abstract: Sergio Arellano Stark, Chilean general who played principal role in 1973 coup overthrowing Pres Salvador Allende and installing Gen Augusto Pinochet as president in what would become brutal 17-year reign, dies at age 94.

byline.contributor: Pascale Bonnefoy contributed reporting from Santiago, Chile.

lead_paragraph: He helped install Augusto Pinochet as president in a 1973 coup and was implicated in the murder or disappearance of more than 75 Chileans.

headline.main: Sergio Arellano Stark, Chilean General Who Led Death Squad, Dies at 94
headline.print_headline: Sergio Arellano Stark, 94; Led Death Squad Under Pinochet
